title: Arqiva's £2bn towers sale paves way for broadcast exit
text:
Arqiva’s sale of its mobile towers portfolio could pave the way for a separate exit of its multi-billion broadcast operations, following two failed attempts to sell the whole business.

The company on Tuesday announced a £2bn sale to Spain’s Cellnex in anticipation for the arrival of 5G technology.

A sale of the unit, which runs thousands of mobile masts in the UK, will transform the Barcelona-based company into the largest independent operator of wireless infrastructure in Britain.

Arqiva was advised by Lazard, which has been appointed on six of the biggest towers deals in Europe this year.

The deal follows a separation of Arqiva’s towers business from its television and radio broadcast infrastructure....
